intro: Cremanthodium maoxianense, commonly known as the Maoxian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant is perennial and thrives in alpine meadows at high altitudes. Its leaves are basal, lanceolate, and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
